title: Police Training Isn’t the Only, or Main, Issue
sub_head: Violent crime is rising because of feckless and misguided leadership and legislation in America’s large cities and states.
body:
In “Defund the Police? No, Fund Them Better” (Declarations, May 29), Peggy Noonan misses the main reason that, as she correctly observes: “Violent crime is rising in almost every major American city, after decades of falling.”
Violent crime is rising because of feckless and misguided leadership and legislation in America’s large cities and states, which have introduced no-bail laws, disbanded anticrime units, made it easy for suspects to identify and retaliate against witnesses, ended broken-windows policing and quality of life law enforcement, and embraced policies designed to empty our prisons. As a result, criminals are running rampant in the streets, shooting, murdering and assaulting innocent citizens, including young children and even babies in strollers.
Our police and communities would benefit from additional resources and training. But that’s not why, as one young mother in Brooklyn recently said: “It’s a war zone out there.” The reason is an abysmal, abject failure of leadership. Given the blood in the streets and the fear in our hearts, I wonder how those “leaders” are able to look at themselves in the mirror.
Marc E. Kasowitz
New York
